vars.title: TechnicalSEO.com | Info, Examples & Tools
vars.description: Brought to you by Merkle, a set of technical SEO topics with examples and tools, to help you make your website technically search engine friendly.

vars.title: Sitemap | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Looking for something on technicalseo.com? Here is the HTML Sitemap to help you navigate through the site.

vars.title: SEO Tools | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: From a list of SEO online resources to a set of handy tools that we developed, this section gives you all you need to optimize your website. Check it out!

vars.title: Online Resources | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Don't know where to start? Well, you're in the right place but here is a list of additional blogs, forums and online tools to help you learn technical SEO.

vars.title: Submit an XML Sitemap ('Ping') | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Simple online tool to 'Ping' search engines (Google and Bing) for updated XML Sitemaps using a simple HTTP request.

vars.title: Get the cached page of any URL | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Simple online tool to get cached pages. A cached page is a version of a web page saved at a specific time by a web crawler (mainly search engines).

vars.title: Google SERP Simulator | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: This simple and handy SEO tool provides a Google snippet preview to check how title tags and meta descriptions are displayed in search results.

vars.title: Locale-Adaptive Testing Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: As Google can now crawl and index locale-adaptive pages, you can use this tool to check the content of a URL for up to 13 languages.

vars.title: hreflang Tags Testing Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: hreflang annotations can be hard to implement properly. This tool allows you to quickly check if hreflang tags for a page (HTML and HTTP headers), and/or in an XML Sitemap, are correct.

vars.title: HTML Snapshot Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: This tool checks if HTML snapshots are directly served to specific User-Agents without them requesting the snapshots via escaped_fragment URLs.

vars.title: robots.txt Testing Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Test your robots.txt with this testing tool. Check if a URL is blocked, which statement is blocking it and for which user agent. You can also check if the resources for the page (CSS and JavaScript) are disallowed!

vars.title: Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) Validator | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Use this tool to check if one or more URLs are valid Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) or not. This testing tool is using the official AMP project validator included in the AMP JS library.

vars.title: Pagination (rel='prev/next') Testing Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: This tool allows you to quickly check if rel=prev and rel=next tags are correctly implemented on a paginated series.

vars.title: Google Local Search Results Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: This tool allows you to check Google local search results via location spoofing.

vars.title: XML Sitemap Generator | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Quickly and easily generate an XML Sitemap with alternate (media and/or hreflang) tags from an Excel (.csv) document.

vars.title: Mobile-Friendly Bulk Testing Tool | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Using Google's API, quickly check if your pages are mobile-friendly.

vars.title: Fetch & Render As Any Bot | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: SEO tool to fetch and render a webpage as any bot. Get the source code, an HTML snapshot, a screenshot and check if resources are blocked from crawling.

vars.title: What is Search Engine Optimization? | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is the process of understanding searcher behavior and audiences, and optimizing web content to deliver a relevant experience.

vars.title: About | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: TechnicalSEO.com was created and is developed, published and maintained by the technical SEO team at Merkle.

vars.title: Directives | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Learn more about directives that can be sent to search engines to tell them what pages they are allowed to crawl on a website and/or add to a their index.

vars.title: HTTP Status Codes | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: When a request is made to a server for a page on a website, the server returns an HTTP status code in response to the request: 200 OK, 404 Not Found, etc.

vars.title: HTTP Status Codes: 404 | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Well optimized with appropriate internal linking and messaging, custom 404 pages can reduce bounce rate and help users navigate to useful pages on the site.

vars.title: Robots.txt | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: The robots.txt file, while not required, helps you guide how search engines crawl your site and can be an integral part of your SEO strategy

vars.title: Robots Tags | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Robots tags are directives that allow webmasters to control how search engines crawl and index the content of a website. They are page-level signals and can be implemented in a meta tag or in an HTTP response header.

vars.title: Annotations | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Annotations are signals that can be sent to search engines for them to better understand the structure of a website and how it relates to other pages or files across the internet.

vars.title: Link Element rel Attribute | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: The rel attribute of a HTML <link> element establishes a relationship between two URLs. It can be used to specifying the authoritative version of a page, indicating an alternate version for a different device, language or region, consolidating equity for a paginated series, etc.

vars.title: Link Element: rel='canonical' | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Canonical tags are used to help search engines understand which URL has authority over others. This increases the likelihood of important pages being crawled, indexed, and ranked.

vars.title: Link Element: rel='prev-next' | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: In instances of paginated series, rel=prev and rel=next tags should be used in order to consolidate equity of individual pages into one URL and resolve eventual near-duplication.

vars.title: Link Element: rel='alternate' media='x' | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: rel=alternate media=x tags are <link> elements used to inform search engines about an alternate URL specifically designed for other media or devices.

vars.title: Link Element: rel='alternate' hreflang='x' | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: hreflang tags help indicate Google and Yandex in what language the content of a page is written and what audience (region) this content is targeting.

vars.title: rel='nofollow' | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: rel=nofollow tags are used to prevent the flow of equity across certain links. It can help prioritize how bots crawl a site and should be use to separate paid links from the organic search landscape.

vars.title: XML Sitemaps and RSS Feeds | TechnicalSEO.com
Content Language Tags | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Certain search engines, such as Bing, do not support the rel='alternate' hreflang='x' annotations. There are three methods that can be used to help these search engines determine which language is being targeted.

vars.title: Website Configuration | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: The website's configuration, while under the responsibility of the web developer(s), has major effects on SEO. URL structure, mobile solution implementation, AJAX but also site latency greatly influence how search engines will rank the site's pages in the SERPs.

vars.title: URLs | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: URLs are a relatively minimal factor in terms of SEO, but there are a few things that are important to consider in order to create SEO friendly URLs.

vars.title: Mobile Site: Responsive Web Design | TechnicalSEO.com
Page Elements | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: The optimization of page elements such as page title, meta description, heading tags or images is critical when it comes to search engine optimization.

vars.title: Web Page Titles & HTML Title Tags | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Page titles are a strong ranking factor for web pages in the SERPs. Find out how to use HTML title tags and create an SEO friendly page title.

vars.title: Knowledge Graph | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: The Knowledge Graph is a body of data displayed in Google's result pages and sourced from a variety of trusted sources on the internet: Wikipedia, Wikidata, The CIA World Factbook, etc.

vars.title: Duplicate Content | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: Duplicate content refers to identical (or nearly identical) content that appears on websites under more than one URL and present major SEO issues.

vars.title: Topics | TechnicalSEO.com
vars.description: A/B Testing and SEO, Inventory Management, Website Migration, Local Search, International SEO, etc.

vars.title: title
vars.description: description
